Key Match Events: Royce Lewis snapped an 0-for-22 slump with a two-run double in the seventh inning.
Willi Castro snapped an 0-for-16 skid with a game-tying single.
Brooks Lee broke out of an 0-for-19 slump with a two-run double.
Matt Wallner homered in the first inning.
Griffin Jax pitched two innings for the first time this season.
Post-Match Reflections: Royce Lewis expressed hope and excitement about the return of key players Byron Buxton and Carlos Correa.
Manager Rocco Baldelli emphasized the urgency of winning with only 16 games remaining.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Twins are three games ahead of the Tigers for the final AL Wild Card spot and six games behind the division-leading Guardians.
Byron Buxton is set to return to the Twins' roster for Friday's series opener against the Reds.
Carlos Correa is also expected to return soon.
